places.name: United States
places.description: The U.S. is a country of 50 states covering a vast swath of North America, with Alaska in the northwest and Hawaii extending the nation’s presence into the Pacific Ocean.

places.name: United States
places.description: The U.S. is a country of 50 states covering a vast swath of North America, with Alaska in the northwest and Hawaii extending the nation’s presence into the Pacific Ocean.

persons.name: Torbern OlafBergman
persons.description: Swedish chemist and mineralogist. At some point Davy acquired a set of letters from Bergman to Franz Schwediaur written in the 1780s which are retained in the Royal Institution (RI MS HD/27/A). ForMemRSL.

persons.name: NehemiahGrew
persons.description: English plant anatomist and physiologist, known as the 'Father of Plant Anatomy'. FRSL.

persons.name: Louis NicolasVauquelin
persons.description: French pharmacist and chemist who met Davy in Paris in 1813. ForMemRSL.

persons.name: Louis NicolasVauquelin
persons.description: French pharmacist and chemist who met Davy in Paris in 1813. ForMemRSL.

persons.name: ThomasThomson
persons.description: Scottish chemist and mineralogist whose writings contributed to the early spread of Dalton's atomic theory. FRSL.

persons.name: ThomasThomson
persons.description: Scottish chemist and mineralogist whose writings contributed to the early spread of Dalton's atomic theory. FRSL.

persons.name: ErasmusDarwin
persons.description: Physician and natural philosopher who was member of the Lunar Society and friend of Priestley and Watt; also a correspondent with Beddoes. FRSL.

persons.name: Thomas AndrewKnight
persons.description: Knight was a botanist and horticulturalist. He was the second president of the Royal Horticulture Society. Davy frequently fished on Knight's esates in the Welsh Marches. FRSL.

works.name: The georgics of Virgil translated: by William Sotheby. Esq.
works.author: William Sothby's Translations of Virgil's Georgics

persons.name: Henri-LouisDuhamel du Monceau
persons.description: French physician, naval engineer and botanist. ForMemRSL.

works.name: The georgics of Virgil translated: by William Sotheby. Esq.
works.author: William Sothby's Translations of Virgil's Georgics

persons.name: FrancisBacon
persons.description: English lawyer, politician and natural philosopher. His influential writings encouraged experimentation and the use of induction in investigating the natural world. He also recommended establishing institutions to promote collaborative research.

persons.name: JohnJay
persons.description: American statesman, patriot, diplomat, abolitionist, signatory of the Treaty of Paris, and a Founding Father of the United States. Davy quotes him as the author of a letter on a species of apple with one sweet and one sour side.

persons.name: Thomas AndrewKnight
persons.description: Knight was a botanist and horticulturalist. He was the second president of the Royal Horticulture Society. Davy frequently fished on Knight's esates in the Welsh Marches. FRSL.

persons.name: Henry VIII
persons.description: King of England from 22 April 1509 until his death in 1547.
